sen.j: 橘奈良麻呂が藤原仲麻呂を滅ぼして、天皇の廃立を企てたが、密告により露見して未遂に終わった。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Naramaro planned to overpower FUJIWARA no Nakamaro and to enthrone and dethrone the emperor; however, the coup did not succeed due to its exposure by a force of betrayal.

sen.j: 橘奈良麻呂の父の左大臣橘諸兄は、聖武天皇の治世に政権を担当していた。
sen.e: Father of TACHIBANA no Naramaro, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) TACHIBANA no Moroe, was in charge of a political affair during the period of the Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 天平15年(743年)、難波行幸中の聖武天皇が病に倒れた時、奈良麻呂は佐伯全成に対し小野東人らと謀り次期天皇に黄文王を擁立する旨の計画を漏らす。
sen.e: In 743 AD, Naramaro leaked his conspiracy, which was planned with ONO no Azumahit, of enthroning Prince Kibume as the next emperor to Saeki no Matanari after Emperor Shomu became ill during the Namuba-gyoko (an imperial visit).

In 743, Naramaro leaked his conspiracy, which was planned with ONO no Azumahito, of enthroning Prince Kibumi as the next emperor to SAEKI no Matanari after Emperor Shomu became ill during the imperial visit to Namba.
sen.cmt: 名字を大文字にしました。難波行幸→imperial visit to Namba としました。
sen.e: In 743, Naramaro leaked his conspiracy, which was planned with ONO no Azumahito, of enthroning Prince Kibumi as the next emperor to SAEKI no Matanari after Emperor Shomu became ill during the imperial visit to Nanba.

sen.j: 天平勝宝元年（749年）、聖武天皇が譲位して皇女の阿倍内親王（孝謙天皇）が即位すると、天皇の母の光明皇后に信任されていた藤原仲麻呂が皇太后のために新設された紫微中台の長官（紫微令）に任命される。
sen.e: In 749 AD, Fujiwara no Nakamaro who was trusted by Empress Komyo, the emperor's mother, was appointed to be Kami (a director) of Shibi Chudai (the office that handled the principal empress Komyo's affairs) which was estabishled for Empress's dowager after Emperor Shomu abdicated her throne to Imperial Princess Abe (Emperor Koken).

In 749, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro who was trusted by Empress Komyo, the emperor's mother, was appointed to be Kami (a director) of Shibi Chudai (the office that handled the Empress Komyo's affairs) which was established for Empress's dowager after Emperor Shomu abdicated his throne to Imperial Princess Abe (Empress Koken).
sen.cmt: 聖武天皇は男性であるため、his throne としました。孝謙天皇は女性であるため、Empress Koken としました。

sen.j: 仲麻呂は孝謙天皇からも寵愛深く、急速に台頭してゆく。
sen.e: Nakamaro was strongly favored by Emperor Koken and rapidly gained power.

sen.j: 一方、阿倍内親王の皇位継承に批判的と見られていた橘諸兄親子の勢力は次第に衰退することとなった。
sen.e: On the other hand, the power of TACHIBANA no Moroe and his father, who were considered to be critical to the succession of Imperial Princess Abe to the Emperor, declined gradually.

sen.j: 藤原氏の台頭に危機感を抱いた奈良麻呂は11月の孝謙天皇即位大嘗祭の時佐伯全成に再び謀反の計画を謀った。
sen.e: Naramaro, who felt threatened by the empowerment of the FUJIWARA clan, talked to Saeki no Mtanari again about his plan of rebellion during the Daijo-sai festival (a festival that celebrated the succession of an emperor) to enthrone Emperor Koken in November.

Naramaro, who felt threatened by the empowerment of the Fujiwara clan, talked to SAEKI no Matanari again about his plan of rebellion during the Daijo-sai festival (a festival that celebrated the succession of an emperor) to enthrone Empress Koken in December.

sen.j: 天平勝宝7歳（755年）、諸兄の従者佐味宮守から、諸兄が酒宴の席で朝廷を誹謗したとの密告があった。
sen.e: In 755 AD, SAMI no Miyamori, a servant of Moroe, leaked information from Moroe, which he revealed during a party, regarding his intended abuse towards the imperial court.

sen.e: Shomu Daijo Tenno (the retired Emperor) was not concerned with this information; however, Moroe, ashamed of his actions, resigned from his position in Feburary, 756.

sen.j: 道祖王（麻度比と改名）、黄文王（久奈多夫礼と改名）、古麻呂、東人、犢養、角足（乃呂志と改名）は同日、過酷な拷問に耐えかねて次々と絶命した。
sen.e: Funado no Okimi (changed his name to Madohi), Prince Kibumi (changed his name to Kunatabure), Komaro, Azumahito, Koshikai, Tsunotari (changed his name to Noroshi) died one after another because of the severe torture.

sen.j: 安宿王は佐渡島、大伴古慈悲（藤原不比等の娘婿）は土佐国に配流された（両者ともその後赦免)。
sen.e: Prince Asukabe was sent to Sadoga-shima Island and OTOMO no Kojihi (a husband of FUJIWARA no Fuhito's daughter) was sent to Tosa Province even though they were remitted later.

sen.j: 塩焼王は直接関与した証拠がなかったために臣籍降下（「氷上塩焼」と改名）することで不問とされた。
sen.e: Prince Shioyaki was not punished because there was no evidence indicating his direct involvment in the rebellion; however, his position as a member of the Imperial family was revoked (changed his name to "HIKAMI no Shioyaki").

sen.j: 反乱計画に直接関与していなかったものの全成は捕縛され奈良麻呂から謀反をもちかけられた顛末を自白した上で自害した。
sen.e: Although Matanari was not directly involved in the planning of the rebellion, he was arrested and confessed, revealing the plans for the rebellion established by Naramaro; he later committed suicide.

sen.e: Furthermore, Udaijin FUJIWARA no Toyonari was considered to be involved in the plot with his son, FUJIWARA no Ototada, and was demoted to Dazainoingenosochi.

sen.e: Moreover,there is a theory that Chunagon (a middle counselor) FUJIWARA no Nagate was politically isolated in the imperial Court, where the Nakamaro clan was empowered, and forced to fall into obscurity.

sen.e: Ironically, people such as Toyonari and Nagate were members of the anti-Nakamaro party as well as close advisors to Emperor Koken, a target of Naramaro.
